newsitem.title: USA: LaserSight securing funds, names officer.
newsitem.headline: LaserSight securing funds, names officer.

text.p: LaserSight Inc said Tuesday it is working with several potential funding sources to complete a planned purchase of certain patents from International Business Machines Corp.
LaserSight had agreed in February 1997 to purchase from IBM certain patents related to ultraviolet light ophthalmic products and procedures for laser vision correction.
LaserSight said it is working on the financing and expects the transaction will close in July.

Separately, LaserSight said J. Richard Crowley was named to the newly created position of chief operating officer of LaserSight Technologies, a division which makes and markets vision correction lasers.
Crowley, 42, most recently was chief operating officer of Clinical Diagnostic Systems Inc in Orlando, Fla.

LaserSight is a holding company with operating subsidiaries engaged in laser manufacturing and international sales, third-party managed vision care administration, ophthalmic practice management, and health and vision care consulting services.
Shares of LaserSight were trading off 1/16 to 6-13/16.
